title: Jeremy Swayman: It ‘doesn’t feel like’ Bruins are playing without a captain this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "I feel like we have so many leaders in that room that are so capable, and it's allowed voices to be heard that necessarily wouldn't be heard.
" Jeremy Swayman has no issue with the lack of a captain on Boston's roster.

John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe For all of the legitimate concerns regarding a retooled roster and whether or not the Bruins’ depth chart had the horses in place to be a competitive club this year, Boston has largely punched above their weight class this fall.

title: Medford elementary school cancels Thursday classes due to ‘suspected’ norovirus outbreak
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Health All other schools in the district will remain open Thursday while Roberts Elementary is cleaned and examined.
Roberts Elementary School in Medford has canceled classes for Thursday due to a suspected norovirus outbreak, officials said.

In a letter sent to families, Medford Public Schools Interim Superintendent Suzanne Galusi and Roberts Elementary Principal Michelle Crowell cited a “high volume of stomach illness cases” reported at the school Wednesday.

title: Worker stabbed at Boston Medical Center, man arrested on assault, drug charges
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The officer was attacked early Wednesday morning after stopping a visitor who was allegedly attempting to leave with a patient’s belongings.
A safety officer was stabbed early Wednesday morning on Boston Medical Center's campus.
Jessica Rinaldi/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: What Joe Mazzulla said about Jayson Tatum’s potential return to Celtics this season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "It’s all up to him.
" Joe Mazzulla could be coaching Jayson Tatum later this season.
Jim Davis/The Boston Globe Jayson Tatum is getting closer and closer to a return to the parquet floor.

title: Rep. Seth Moulton wants to allow lawsuits against ICE agents with new ‘NOEM Act’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The North Shore Democrat gearing up for a primary against Sen.
Ed Markey introduced the NOEM Act to allow lawsuits against federal immigration agents in civil rights law.
Congressman Seth Moulton speaks during a town hall event at Tewksbury High School on June 16, 2025, in Tewksbury.

title: Stefon Diggs describes Patriots receiver room as ‘seven dogs, one bone’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “I just think that it’s an unselfish [group] and you’re pulling for your brother.
" Stefon Diggs is one of several Patriots wideouts who have stepped up this season.
(AP Photo/Phelan M.

title: Big Y announces 4 new Mass. stores: Is one arriving near you?
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The Springfield-based chain said the stores will be open between 2026 and 2027, depending on the location.
The Big Y grocery chain, based in Springfield, has announced four new locations.

Jonathan Wiggs/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo December 10, 2025 | 6:54 PM 1 minute to read The popular Massachusetts-based supermarket chain Big Y is expanding the brand with four new locations statewide.

title: Driver shot at while parking car in Cambridge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Police are investigating but did not confirm whether the armed suspect in Wednesday’s shooting has been identified.
Cambridge police are investigating a shooting that happened early Wednesday morning.
Matthew J Lee/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo December 10, 2025 | 6:02 PM 1 minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Why Stefon Diggs believes it’s ‘good’ that Patriots are underdogs against the Bills
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "This team is full of [players] that were castoffs and people who were cut or people who didn’t necessarily get the opportunity that they wanted.
" Stefon Diggs is welcoming New England's status as an underdog on Sunday.

AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster By Conor Ryan December 10, 2025 | 5:24 PM 2 minutes to read FOXBOROUGH — The New England Patriots (11-2) boast a better record than the Buffalo Bills (9-4) entering Sunday’s anticipated rematch at Gillette Stadium.

title: Kroger interim CEO Ron Sargent buys former Celtics co-owner Steve Pagliuca’s Back Bay mansion
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Luxury Homes Sargent, who previously served as the CEO of Staples, purchased the pricey pad in Boston's Back Bay neighborhood for $11.
5 million.
362 Marlborough Street.
